review: I Love the Amazon Fire TV Stick. My husband labeled it "Mommy's new toy":-)  I have no previous experience with Roku or Hulu, or any other similar product so I don't really have anything to compare it to...  I do know that I love the concept of having my photos, movies, music, t.v. programs, etc.  in one convenient place!  Who knew that years ago when I first subscribed to Amazon Prime for the 2-day shipping, that I would end up loving all of these "extras"?!  I put the free app on my phone for voice control and that was super easy & cool to use too!  We haven't tried gaming yet, but think that will be a fun family activity (since our other video games are in the kids' area).

author: David Tran

review: I really enjoy the speed of the Amazon Fire TV stick.  It is much faster than my Roku LT. I have a 42" 2012 Samsung Plasma TV. The USB port on this TV was not powerful enough to run the Fire TV Stick despite it being powerful enough to run my Chromecast. A bit disappointed that I had to plug it into an outlet using the supplied power block (I like to keep all my wires hidden).  I discovered this issue while the Fire Stick was going through its initial updates/setup. It restarted itself repeatedly, maybe 15-20 times. I first thought it was part of the update process but soon realized it was due to insufficient USB power coming from the TV.  I also have a 27" 2014 LED Toshiba TV.  This TV's USB DID provide sufficient power to run the Fire TV Stick. I am unsure what the Mah output are for these TVs.My wife and I use the Fire Stick solely for Netflix.  She prefers the Roku menu layout over the Fire. I believe it's a bit more straight forward on the Roku, plus the Fire is heavily designed for the Amazon Prime user which we are not.Final Take:  For the person who mainly only wants something for Netflix and also prefers a dedicated remote, I would highly recommend this product!  If you are OK with using your Android/iOS device as a remote I would go with the Chromecast which requires less power to operate and can sometimes be found at the Big Box stores for around $25. Hope this helps.
